p: The Asian tiger mosquito, Ae. albopictus, has dispersed extensively from its native tropical range in Southeast Asia and is now found on every continent except Antarctica [1], [2]. The last decade has seen a dramatic expansion of Ae. albopictus into temperate regions of Europe and North America [3]â€“ [5]. In many parts of its expanded range, this species is implicated as a significant vector of emerging and re-emerging arboviruses such as dengue (DENV) and chikungunya (CHIKV).
